title: Ticket #7103: obituary missing last k lines of daemon log
description:
Tetsuya Miyoshi of Argo noticed that the obituary mails sent the master sends stopped including the last twenty lines of the dead daemon's log. This appears to have been caused by [49036], which removed one line too many in masterDaemon.cpp (log_name should still be set). The quick fix, which should work for almost everyone, is to restore the missing line.

The long fix would require the daemon in question to tell the master which log file it's been updating, since the master can't otherwise be sure (and not just because of the obvious config file changes/daemon restarts/reconfigs -- what about condor_config_val -set). One possibility is to include its current log file name in its keep-alive payload.

Additionally, everyone thinks that 20 lines is far too small of default. Let's try 200, instead.
